page.title: 07Farming in the Watford area.
page.content: We went to see Mr Lory who farms nearby on Home Farm. He said that his farm was 3000 acres stretching as far as Tring. It is a mixed farm. The section of farm in our area is 300 acres and rented from The Grove which is now owned by British Rail but was the house which used to belong to the Earl of Clarendon. On this land he has a herd of Friesian cows. The milk is sent to the Milk Marketing Board. On this part of the farm at Christmas they raise turkeys that have been especially fattened. The have a workforce of 14 for all the farm, including 1 secretary. There is a lot of machinery including tractors which can do the work of 20 men. The farmworkers like farming because it is outdoor work, a challenge and there is variety. Large or small farms can survive in 1985 if well planned.
